title: Chelsea have paid Jose Mourinho and staff £31.4m for being SACKED since 2007

Chelsea have paid Jose Mourinho and his staff an astonishing £31.4million just for being sacked since 2007. 
The club's accounts reveal that Mourinho and co were paid £8.3million when he was sacked in December 2015, while he and his staff received £23.1million when they were axed in 2007. 
Owner Roman Abramovich was so appalled by the sums that he vowed to never let it happen again, but the Special One and his coaches still took what appears to be a year's salary when they were let go last season. 
The same staff, Rui Faria, Silvino Louro and Jose Morais, now all work under Mourinho at Manchester United on similar terms. Mourinho's trusty assistant Rui Faria joined him at United (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) Abramovich vowed not to have to make such a big payout again 
Chelsea spent £67million to end their kit deal with Adidas to allow them to pen a new contract with Nike, thought to be worth £900m over 15 years, figures revealed on Companies House reveal. 
The need for the Blues' new ground is also apparent, with figures showing that money generated at Stamford Bridge accounts for only 21 per cent of the club's overall revenue. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
